title: Conjugate (square roots)
summary: In mathematics, the conjugate of an expression of the form a + b d {\displaystyle a+b{\sqrt {d}}} is a âˆ’ b d , {\displaystyle a-b{\sqrt {d}},} provided that d {\displaystyle {\sqrt {d}}} does not appear in a and b. One says also that the two expressions are conjugate.
